Deprecated API

  • Interfaces 
    Interface Description
    org.apache.cayenne.access.DataPortDelegate
    since 4.0
    org.apache.cayenne.map.EntityListenerFactory
    since 4.0, as EntityResolver no longer loads listeners from its DataMaps.
    org.apache.cayenne.reflect.Property
    since 4.0 renamed to PropertyDescriptor.
  • Classes 
    Class Description
    org.apache.cayenne.access.DataPort
    since 4.0
    org.apache.cayenne.access.Transaction
    since 4.0. For manual transaction management use BaseTransaction static methods or better - ServerRuntime.performInTransaction(org.apache.cayenne.tx.TransactionalOperation) . Also note that since 4.0 an actual Transaction is an interface located in a different package: Transaction
    org.apache.cayenne.cache.EhCacheQueryCache
    since 4.0 please use JCacheQueryCache (provided by "cayenne-jcache" module)
    org.apache.cayenne.cache.OSQueryCache
    since 4.0 as OSCache project is abandoned
    org.apache.cayenne.configuration.rop.client.ClientLocalRuntime
    since 4.0, use ClientRuntimeBuilder.local(Injector)
    org.apache.cayenne.map.EntityListener
    since 4.0, as EntityResolver no longer loads listeners from its DataMaps.
    org.apache.cayenne.query.NamedQuery
    since 4.0 you should use MappedSelect or MappedExec instead.

    Field Description
    org.apache.cayenne.access.DataContext.transactionFactory
    since 4.0 used in a method that itself should be deprecated, so this is a temp code

    since 4.0 DataRowStoreFactory establishes EventBridge.
    org.apache.cayenne.access.DataRowStore.notifyingRemoteListeners
    since 4.0 does nothing. Previously it used to check if need to create EventBridge.

    org.apache.cayenne.access.DataRowStore.REMOTE_NOTIFICATION_PROPERTY

    since 4.0, use Constants.SNAPSHOT_CACHE_SIZE_PROPERTY

    since 4.0, never used actually

    since 4.0 moved to cayenne-client org.apache.cayenne.configuration.rop.client.ClientConstants.

    since 4.0 renamed to Constants.JDBC_MAX_QUEUE_WAIT_TIME. Property name is preserved.

    Method Description
    org.apache.cayenne.access.DataContext.setTransactionFactory​(TransactionFactory)
    since 4.0 avoid using this directly. Transaction management at this level will be eventually removed
    org.apache.cayenne.access.DataDomain.initWithProperties​(Map<String, String>)
    since 4.0 properties are processed by the DI provider.
    org.apache.cayenne.access.DataNode.getDataSourceLocation()
    since 4.0. This information is irrelevant at the DataNode level
    org.apache.cayenne.access.DataNode.setDataSourceLocation​(String)
    since 4.0. This information is irrelevant at the DataNode level
    org.apache.cayenne.access.DataRowStore.isNotifyingRemoteListeners()
    org.apache.cayenne.access.DataRowStore.setNotifyingRemoteListeners​(boolean)
    org.apache.cayenne.access.jdbc.JDBCResultIterator.isClosingConnection()
    since 4.0 always returns false. Connection closing is outside the scope of this iterator. See ConnectionAwareResultIterator for a replacement.
    org.apache.cayenne.access.jdbc.JDBCResultIterator.setClosingConnection​(boolean)
    since 4.0 does nothing. Connection closing is outside the scope of this iterator. See ConnectionAwareResultIterator for a replacement.
    org.apache.cayenne.access.Transaction.bindThreadTransaction​(Transaction)
    org.apache.cayenne.access.Transaction.getThreadTransaction()
    org.apache.cayenne.cache.EhCacheQueryCache.getDefaultCache()
    since 4.0 - this method is no longer in use. If you are overriding it, override EhCacheQueryCache.cacheName(QueryMetadata) instead.
    org.apache.cayenne.cache.NestedQueryCache.clear()
    since 4.0
    org.apache.cayenne.cache.NestedQueryCache.size()
    since 4.0
    org.apache.cayenne.cache.QueryCache.clear()
    since 4.0. Please use implementation specific methods to perform cache management tasks.
    org.apache.cayenne.cache.QueryCache.size()
    since 4.0. Please use implementation specific methods to perform cache management tasks.
    org.apache.cayenne.configuration.CayenneRuntime.getContext()
    since 3.1 use better named CayenneRuntime.newContext() instead.
    org.apache.cayenne.configuration.server.ServerRuntimeBuilder.builder()
    since 4.0.M5 in favor of ServerRuntime.builder()
    org.apache.cayenne.conn.DataSourceInfo.getPasswordEncoder()
    since 4.0 as class loading should not happen here.
    org.apache.cayenne.datasource.DriverDataSource.getConnectionUrl()
    since 4.0. Connection parameters are immutable and not readable.

    since 4.0. Connection parameters are immutable and not readable.
    org.apache.cayenne.datasource.DriverDataSource.getUserName()
    since 4.0. Connection parameters are immutable and not readable.

    since 4.0. Connection parameters are immutable.
    org.apache.cayenne.datasource.DriverDataSource.setPassword​(String)
    since 4.0. Connection parameters are immutable.
    org.apache.cayenne.datasource.DriverDataSource.setUserName​(String)
    since 4.0. Connection parameters are immutable.

    since 4.0 use DbAdapter.getQuotingStrategy().

    since 4.0 BatchQueryBuilderfactory is attached to the DataNode.

    since 4.0 use JdbcAdapter.getQuotingStrategy().

    since 4.0 BatchQueryBuilderfactory is attached to the DataNode.

    since 4.0 renamed to QuotingStrategy.quotedFullyQualifiedName(DbEntity).

    since 4.0
    org.apache.cayenne.dba.TypesMapping.supportsLength​(int)
    Returns true if supplied type can have a length attribute as a part of column definition.
    org.apache.cayenne.di.Binder.bindList​(String)
    since 4.0, use type-safe methods Binder.bindList(Class) or Binder.bindList(Class, String)
    org.apache.cayenne.di.Binder.bindMap​(String)
    since 4.0, use use type-safe methods Binder.bindMap(Class) or Binder.bindMap(Class, String)

    org.apache.cayenne.ejbql.parser.JavaCharStream.getLine()

    since 4.0 use Expression.appendAsEJBQL(Appendable, String)

    since 4.0 use Expression.appendAsString(Appendable).

    since 4.0 use Expression.params(Map)
    org.apache.cayenne.exp.Expression.fromString​(String)
    since 4.0 use ExpressionFactory.exp(String, Object...)

    org.apache.cayenne.exp.parser.JavaCharStream.getLine()

    since 4.0 use SimpleNode.appendAsEJBQL(Appendable, String).
    org.apache.cayenne.exp.parser.SimpleNode.encodeAsString​(PrintWriter)
    since 4.0 use SimpleNode.appendAsString(Appendable).

    since 4.0 connection events are logged by the DataSources using their own logger.

    since 4.0 connection events are logged by the DataSources using their own logger.

    since 4.0 use JdbcEventLogger.logQuery(String, ParameterBinding[]).

    since 4.0 use #logQuery(String, ParameterBinding[], long).
    org.apache.cayenne.log.Slf4jJdbcEventLogger.logQueryParameters​(String, List<DbAttribute>, List<Object>, boolean)
    since 4.0
    org.apache.cayenne.map.DataMap.addDefaultEntityListener​(EntityListener)
    since 4.0 unused as listeners are no longer tied to a DataMap.
    org.apache.cayenne.map.DataMap.getDefaultEntityListener​(String)
    since 4.0 unused, as listeners are no longer tied to a DataMap.
    org.apache.cayenne.map.DataMap.getDefaultEntityListeners()
    since 4.0 unused as listeners are no longer tied to a DataMap.
    org.apache.cayenne.map.DataMap.removeDefaultEntityListener​(String)
    since 4.0 unused as listeners are no longer tied to a DataMap.
    org.apache.cayenne.map.Embeddable.getJavaClass()
    since 4.0 this method based on statically defined class loading algorithm is not going to work in environments like OSGi. AdhocObjectFactory should be used as it can provide the environment-specific class loading policy.
    org.apache.cayenne.map.EntityResolver.applyObjectLayerDefaults()
    since 4.0 does nothing. Previously it used to create runtime ObjRelationships, that broke a lot of things.
    org.apache.cayenne.map.EntityResolver.clearCache()
    since 4.0 in favor of EntityResolver.refreshMappingCache().
    org.apache.cayenne.map.EntityResolver.getResultSets()
    since 4.0 use EntityResolver.getResults().
    org.apache.cayenne.map.EntityResolver.isIndexedByClass()
    since 4.0. There's no replacement. This property is meaningless and is no longer respected by the code.
    org.apache.cayenne.map.EntityResolver.lookupInheritanceTree​(String)
    since 4.0 use EntityResolver.getInheritanceTree(String).
    org.apache.cayenne.map.EntityResolver.lookupObjEntity​(Class<?>)
    since 4.0, use EntityResolver.getObjEntity(Class).
    org.apache.cayenne.map.EntityResolver.lookupProcedure​(Query)
    since 4.0. Use q.getMetaData(resolver).getProcedure()
    org.apache.cayenne.map.EntityResolver.setEntityListenerFactory​(EntityListenerFactory)
    since 4.0 this method does nothing, as EntityResolver no longer loads listeners from its DataMaps.
    org.apache.cayenne.map.EntityResolver.setIndexedByClass​(boolean)
    since 4.0. There's no replacement. This property is meaningless.
    org.apache.cayenne.map.ObjEntity.addEntityListener​(EntityListener)
    since 4.0 unused, as listeners are no longer mapped in a DataMap.
    org.apache.cayenne.map.ObjEntity.getEntityListener​(String)
    since 4.0 unused, as listeners are no longer mapped in a DataMap.
    org.apache.cayenne.map.ObjEntity.getEntityListeners()
    since 4.0 unused, as listeners are no longer mapped in a DataMap.
    org.apache.cayenne.map.ObjEntity.getJavaClass()
    since 4.0 this method based on statically defined class loading algorithm is not going to work in environments like OSGi. AdhocObjectFactory should be used as it can provide the environment-specific class loading policy.
    org.apache.cayenne.map.ObjEntity.isExcludingDefaultListeners()
    since 4.0 unused, as listeners are no longer mapped in a DataMap.
    org.apache.cayenne.map.ObjEntity.isExcludingSuperclassListeners()
    since 4.0 unused, as listeners are no longer mapped in a DataMap.
    org.apache.cayenne.map.ObjEntity.removeEntityListener​(String)
    since 4.0 unused, as listeners are no longer mapped in a DataMap.
    org.apache.cayenne.map.ObjEntity.setExcludingDefaultListeners​(boolean)
    since 4.0 unused, as listeners are no longer mapped in a DataMap.
    org.apache.cayenne.map.ObjEntity.setExcludingSuperclassListeners​(boolean)
    since 4.0 unused, as listeners are no longer mapped in a DataMap.

    org.apache.cayenne.query.Query.getDataMap()
    since 4.0, QueryDescriptor.getDataMap() should be used instead
    org.apache.cayenne.query.Query.getName()
    QueryDescriptor.getName() should be used instead
    org.apache.cayenne.query.QueryChain.getDataMap()
    org.apache.cayenne.query.QueryChain.getName()

    org.apache.cayenne.query.QueryChain.setName​(String)
    org.apache.cayenne.query.QueryMetadata.getCacheGroups()
    since 4.0 only single cache group supported, use QueryMetadata.getCacheGroup() instead
    org.apache.cayenne.query.QueryMetadata.getOrginatingQuery()
    since 4.0, use QueryMetadata.getOriginatingQuery()
    org.apache.cayenne.query.QueryMetadataProxy.getCacheGroups()
    org.apache.cayenne.query.QueryMetadataProxy.getOrginatingQuery()
    org.apache.cayenne.query.RefreshQuery.getDataMap()
    org.apache.cayenne.query.SelectQuery.setFetchingDataRows​(boolean)
    since 4.0, use SelectQuery.dataRowQuery(Class, Expression) to create DataRow query instead.
    org.apache.cayenne.reflect.LifecycleCallbackRegistry.addListener​(LifecycleEvent, Class<?>, String)
    org.apache.cayenne.remote.RemoteSession.createServerEventBridge()
    since 4.0. Factory creation should is handled by the client connection.
    org.apache.cayenne.resource.ClassLoaderResourceLocator.getClassLoader()
    since 4.0 unused, as AdhocObjectFactory.getClassLoader() is used instead.
    org.apache.cayenne.util.Util.getJavaClass​(String)
    since 4.0 this method based on statically defined class loading algorithm is not going to work in environments like OSGi. AdhocObjectFactory should be used as it can provide the environment-specific class loading policy.
  • Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    org.apache.cayenne.access.DataDomain​(String, Map<String, String>)
    since 4.0 unused
    org.apache.cayenne.configuration.rop.client.ClientModule​(Map<String, String>)
    since 4.0 in favour of ClientRuntimeBuilder
    org.apache.cayenne.configuration.rop.client.ClientRuntime​(Map<String, String>, Collection<Module>)
    since 4.0, use ClientRuntime.builder() instead.
    org.apache.cayenne.configuration.server.ServerModule​(String, String...)
    since 4.0 use ServerRuntimeBuilder.addConfig(String) and/or ServerModule.contributeProjectLocations(Binder) to specify locations.
    org.apache.cayenne.configuration.server.ServerRuntime​(String, Module...)
    since 4.0 use ServerRuntime.builder().
    org.apache.cayenne.configuration.server.ServerRuntimeBuilder()
    since 4.0.M5 in favor of ServerRuntime.builder()
    org.apache.cayenne.datasource.DriverDataSource​(String, String)
    since 4.0 as class loading should not happen here. Use { DriverDataSource(Driver, String, String, String).
    org.apache.cayenne.exp.Property​(String)
    use factory method Property.create("propertyName", PropertyType.class)
    org.apache.cayenne.query.RefreshQuery()
    since 4.0, "refresh all" query will drop all cache contents
